start.situation: You are a young noble in a medieval kingdom. Your father, the king, has just died unexpectedly. The court is in mourning, and you must decide how to handle this crisis.

choices.text: Mourn publicly
Begin planning the succession
Investigate the cause of death

node1.situation: As you mourn publicly, you notice that some courtiers are whispering among themselves, casting suspicious glances at your mother, the queen. She's been acting strangely since father's death, and some people suspect she might be involved in his passing.

choices.text: Question your mother directly
Talk to a trusted advisor about your concerns
Try to ignore the rumors and focus on mourning

node2.situation: You call a meeting with your most trusted advisors to discuss the succession. They are shocked and saddened by your father's sudden passing, but they are also eager to help you make the right decisions.

choices.text: Follow tradition and name a regent until I come of age
Take control of the kingdom myself, citing my father's wishes for me to be prepared for power
Ask your advisors to propose a candidate from outside the royal family, potentially bringing fresh perspectives and skills

node3.situation: You call for the royal physician and begin questioning them about your father's sudden passing.

choices.text: Demand to know the truth, no matter how uncomfortable it may be
Ask if there were any signs or symptoms that might have indicated a pre-existing condition
Suggest performing an autopsy to rule out foul play

node_908.situation: You approach your mother, who looks taken aback by your directness. 'What's wrong, child?' she asks, her voice laced with concern.

choices.text: Tell her you're worried about her well-being
Accuse her of being involved in your father's death
Ask if she knows anything about the whispers among courtiers

node_841.situation: You seek out a trusted advisor, one of your father's most loyal and wise councilors. You're met with a warm smile and an expression of genuine concern for your well-being.

choices.text: Ask about Mother's behavior directly
Express your fears and uncertainty
Request a thorough investigation into Father's death

node_143.situation: As you propose naming a regent, your advisors look at each other nervously, sensing that this may be a sign of weakness.

choices.text: A regent would provide stability and continuity until I'm old enough to take over
But what if the regent gets too powerful? What's to stop them from trying to seize the throne for themselves?
I'm not sure I want someone else making decisions for me. Can't we just trust my instincts and make it up as we go along?

node_116.situation: Your advisors look at you in surprise, some of them murmuring among themselves. 'You're sure this is what your father would have wanted?' one of them asks, their tone skeptical.

choices.text: I'm positive, I've studied our kingdom's laws and I'm well-prepared to take the reins
I understand your reservations, but I think this is what's best for the kingdom. Let's discuss the details and move forward
I'm not sure if this is the right decision, maybe we should consider other options?

node_547.situation: Your advisors begin to discuss potential candidates from outside the royal family, weighing their qualifications and merits.

choices.text: Consider a skilled military commander from a neighboring kingdom
Look at a brilliant diplomat who has successfully negotiated treaties between nations
Evaluate a renowned scholar who has written extensively on the art of statecraft and governance

node_1010.situation: The royal physician looks concerned and begins to explain that there were some subtle signs that might have indicated a pre-existing condition.

choices.text: Press for more information about these signs
Ask if your father's condition was related to his recent actions or decisions
Request a full examination of the body and any records from previous healers

node_138.situation: The royal physician hesitates, clearly uncomfortable with your suggestion.

choices.text: Insist on an autopsy, citing your father's importance to the kingdom
Back down, recognizing the physician's unease and not wanting to push the issue further
Ask if there are any other factors that might have contributed to your father's sudden passing, trying to gather more information

node_228.situation: Your mother's expression turns sympathetic as she says, 'Ah, child, you're worried about me? What's troubling you?'

choices.text: Ask her if she's been feeling okay lately
Tell her it's just that you've noticed her getting older and want to make sure she's doing well
Ask her if there's something specific on your mind that's making you worried

node_919.situation: Your mother's expression turns cold, her eyes flashing with anger. 'How dare you,' she hisses, her voice low and menacing.

choices.text: Defend your accusation
Back down, realizing the mistake
Insist on the truth

node_986.situation: Your mother's expression turns thoughtful, and she says, 'Ah, you've noticed those whispers among the courtiers? I'd rather not speculate on their motives, but I can tell you that there are some who would stop at nothing to gain power.'

choices.text: Press your mother for more information
Assume the whispers have nothing to do with you and change the subject
Ask if she knows anything about the royal family's involvement

node_851.situation: The advisor's expression turns serious, and they lean in, lowering their voice. 'Your mother has been... struggling lately. The pressures of being queen are taking a toll on her mental health.'

choices.text: Tell me more about what's going on.
What can I do to help her?
I don't care about that right now. What's the real reason she's been making these decisions?

node_56.situation: The trusted advisor's expression turns sympathetic, and they place a reassuring hand on your shoulder.

choices.text: Share your concerns about the rebellion
Ask for guidance on how to proceed
Open up about your doubts and fears

node_814.situation: The advisor's expression turns somber as they begin to explain their findings, 'I've spoken to several people who were in the castle that night...'

choices.text: What did you learn from them?
Are you certain there was no one else involved?

node_655.situation: As you open up about your feelings, the courtiers' faces grow more serious and concerned. They listen intently as you share your deepest sorrows.

choices.text: Reveal your true intentions
Seek their counsel and guidance
Push them away, unsure of what to do

node_741.situation: The courtiers, sensing your determination to maintain composure, begin to probe deeper into your grief.

choices.text: Open up about your emotions
Redirect the conversation to a more pleasant topic
Ask them what they want, and why they're really here

node_526.situation: The courtiers exchange uneasy glances, and one of them leans in to whisper: 'Actually, your majesty, some of us have noticed that Queen Elara has been... distracted lately.'

choices.text: Press for more information about the queen's distraction
Tell the courtiers it's not their concern and move on
Order the courtiers to investigate further and report back to you

node_521.situation: Your advisors exchange skeptical glances, sensing that your decision may have been influenced by your youth and inexperience.

choices.text: I'm the ruler, I know what's best
Perhaps we should consider alternative options?
I'm just trying to ensure the kingdom's future

node_447.situation: One of your advisors, a wise old man named Elwynn, speaks up to address your concerns.

choices.text: Perhaps we should establish clear guidelines for the regent's powers and limitations?
I'm not sure that's enough. What if they try to manipulate us instead of following our rules?
Let's just focus on finding the right person for the job and trust their judgment.
